result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Kuduk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Rusk County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
The Court orders that if the defendant fails to pay the fine and costs within 60 days of the date of conviction or if the Court has authorized monthly payments for the fine and costs and they have not been paid, the Court will enter a judgment and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect this debt.  You must keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

DE will provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J Kuduk

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel J Kuduk in court with attorney Stephanie E Thomas.  Defendant Daniel J Kuduk in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM175, 15CT66, 16CM7, 16CM18, 16CT2.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  

15CM155-DRI

15CM175-DE will enter a plea of G, G.  DE will pay a fine of $25.00 fine/CC/DNA samle and surcharge

15CT66-CT 2-DRI.  CT 1, G, DE will pay a fine of $4026.00, serve 110 days jail with huber, 30 month revocation of DL, 30 month IID, AODA assessment/followup and $22.90 restitution.  DE has a total of 72 days credit. 

16CM7-DRI

16CM18-Ct's 1-4 will be DRI, DE will enter a plea of G to Ct 5.  Court will order sentence withheld, one year probation, consecutive to jail time ordered.  Fine of $25.00/CC, DNA sample/surcharge

16CT2-CT'S 1,2,4 WILL BE DRI.  DE WILL PLEA  G TO CT 3-OWI 4TH.  Court will accept and find the DE guilty.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  DE will pay a fine of $2497.00, 165 days jail with huber privilege and good time,  30 month revocation of DL concurrent with 15CT66, 30 month IID, AODA assessment/followup, $22.90 restitution.  Uncharged incident on 12-01-16 will be dismissed/read in, (16GF315, 2016-2567)  JAIL TIME WILL BE CONSECUTIVE.

Days credit are as follows:
15CT66-12 DAYS
16CT02-08 DAYS
16CM18-45 DAYS
16CM155-2 DAYS
12-01-16 INCIDENT-5 DAYS
De has indicated undecided about seeking PCR
Sentencing hearing on December 6, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM175, 15CT66, 16CM7, 16CM18,16CT2.  DE does not appear.  Atty had a VM from DE at 6:00AM that he wishes to have new counsel appointed.

Defendant Daniel J Kuduk in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM155, 15CT66, 16CM7, 16CM18, 16CT2.  Atty would like sentencing rescheduled. Set for 9/27/16 @ 2:00PM.
Sentencing hearing on September 27, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on September 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Review hearing on April 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Review hearing on April 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

All bonds concurrent.  Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.  Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid operating privilege.  Defendant is not to possess or consume any medications not prescribed by a physician.  Not to possess or consume any illicit substances.  All prescribed medications must remain in the original container and be taken only as prescribed.  No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  No verbally or physically abusive contact with Gary Kuduk, no contact with Rodney Johnson, Chad Olson, David Severson, Daren Kempen, William Gunns, Roger Paffle, Victoria Mobraaten, Robert Malec, James Waters.  DE will be enrolled by the end of the this week in the IDIP and actively participating.  If enrolled DE does not need to attend status conference on 4-11-16 @ 2:30pm.  DE will sign a release with Aurora that he is actively enrolled/participating in program.

Defendant Daniel J Kuduk in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  James J Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM155, 15CT66, 16CM7, 16CM18.  Atty requesting more time to review discovery.  RH 3-08-16 @ 3:00PM.  Review hearing scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

No verbally or physically abusive contact with Gary Kuduk, no contact with Rodney Johnson, Chad Olson, David Severson, Daren Kempen, William Gunns, Roger Paffle, Victoria Mobraaten, Robert Malec, James Waters.

Defendant Daniel J Kuduk in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM155, 15CM175.  15CM175-Init App-  Waive reading of the CC, enter plea of NG to misdemeanor counts.  $500.00 sign bond, no verbally or physically abusive contact with Gary Kuduk, no contact with Rodney Johnson, Chad Olson, David Severson, Daren Kempen, William Gunns, Roger Paffle, Victoria Mobraaten, Robert Malec, James Waters.  Set all cases for 2-16-16 @ 10:00AM
